caption.p: Schematic representation of convalescent plasma components and its mechanisms of action. A. Main convalescent plasma components. B. Antiviral effects of NAbs. IgG and IgM are the main isotypes, although IgA may be also important, particularly in mucosal viral infections. Other non-NAbs may exert a protective effect. The humoral immune response is mainly directed towards spike (S) protein. C. Anti-inflammatory effects of CP include network of autoantibodies and control of an overactive immune system ( i.e., cytokine storm, Th1/Th17 ratio, complement activation and regulation of a hypercoagulable state) (see text for details). N: Nucleoprotein; M: Membrane; E: Envelope.
